core

Class CentralServerResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.CentralServerResource

  • public class CentralServerResource
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will handle the call from the client to the central server and will send the answer.
    Author:
    Clement Gautrais, Paul Chaignon

    • Method Detail

      • addCentralServerListener

        public static void addCentralServerListener(CentralServerListener listener)
        Add a central server listener to the listeners.
        Parameters:
        listener - The new listener.

      • removeCentralServerListener

        public static void removeCentralServerListener(CentralServerListener listener)
        Remove a central server listener from the listeners.
        Parameters:
        listener - The new listener.

      • getCentralServerListeners

        public static CentralServerListener[] getCentralServerListeners()
        Returns:
        The central server listeners.

      • getBestMove

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getBestMove(java.lang.String fen)
        Receive a FEN from a client and return the best move corresponding after requesting all the resources. The client calls this method with an HTTP GET request on /rest/{fen}.
        Parameters:
        fen - The FEN send via the URL.
        Returns:
        The best move computed.

      • endOfGame

        public static javax.ws.rs.core.Response endOfGame(int gameId,
                                  java.lang.String fen)
        End a game and reward the resources depending on the result of the game. One the resources are rewarded, the game is deleted from the database. The client calls this method with an HTTP DELETE request on /rest/{gameId}.
        Parameters:
        gameId - The id of the game to end.
        fen - The final FEN.
        Returns:
        Ok if the game is deleted from the database.

      • getBestMove

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getBestMove(int gameId,
                                    java.lang.String fen)
        Receive a FEN from a client and return the best move corresponding after requesting all the resources. This method also keeps statistics about the moves suggested to reward the resources at the end of the game. The client calls this method with an HTTP GET request on /rest/{gameId}/{fen}.
        Parameters:
        gameId - The id of the game.
        fen - The current FEN.
        Returns:
        The best move computed in the requested format (SAN or LAN).

      • debug

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response debug(java.lang.String fen)
        Receive an FEN from a client and return all the information used in a normal computation. It will return all intermediate scores as an HTML document. The client calls this method with a HTTP GET request on /rest/debug/{fen}.
        Parameters:
        fen - The current FEN.
        Returns:
        All the information on the computation as an HTML document.

      • startGame

        public static javax.ws.rs.core.Response startGame(boolean san)
        Create a new game with a random generated id. The client may indicate at this moment if he want that the server returns it SAN or LAN moves. The client calls this method with an HTTP POST request on /rest.
        Parameters:
        san - The boolean send in the request. If true, the move sent by the central server will be in SAN. Is true by default.
        Returns:
        The id of the game created.

      • preflightStartGame

        public static javax.ws.rs.core.Response preflightStartGame(@HeaderParam(value="Access-Control-Request-Headers")
                                           java.lang.String requestH)
        This method is only called to respond to HTTP OPTIONS requests send by AJAX scripts. AJAX scripts send a preflight request to determine if the request to come is allowed by the server.
        Parameters:
        requestH - Headers to check.
        Returns:
        Headers to specify that the headers requested are allowed.

      • preflightEndOfGame

        public static javax.ws.rs.core.Response preflightEndOfGame(@HeaderParam(value="Access-Control-Request-Headers")
                                           java.lang.String requestH)
        This method is only called to respond to HTTP OPTIONS requests send by AJAX scripts. AJAX scripts send a preflight request to determine if the request to come is allowed by the server.
        Parameters:
        requestH - Headers to check.
        Returns:
        Headers to specify that the headers requested are allowed.
